results.title: Tiger shikar in India (D)
results.creator_credit: Ellis R. Duncan, Frank Ferrin and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description:
An American film man tells of a tiger shooting expedition in northern India. Describes the facilities for big game hunters, and shows shooting from the back of an elephant and from a hide in a tree.
WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellis R. Duncan, Frank Ferrin and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Tiger shikar (D)
results.brief_description:
Two tiger hunts in northern India. In the first, villagers go after a man-eater which threatens their safety, using b eaters, nets and spears to surround, trap and kill the tiger. In the second, big-game hunters from overseas, riding elephants and accompanied by beaters, shoot tigers for sport.
NB: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Tied Test
results.brief_description: The only tie in test history took place in the first test between Australia and the West Indies in December 1960. The drama and tension that emerged on the final afternoon of the match culminating in what was probably the greatest ever test match.
results.description: The only tie in test history took place in the first test between Australia and the West Indies in December 1960. The drama and tension that emerged on the final afternoon of the match culminating in what was probably the greatest ever test match.

results.title: Tiddalik: based on an aboriginal legend
results.creator_credit: Pamela Abbey and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Based on an aboriginal legend, this animated film tells the story of Tiddalik, a greedy frog who drains the world of water, and the efforts of his fellow creatures to replenish the water supply.

results.title: Ticket to Turkey
results.brief_description: A record of a train journey from London to Istanbul by Johnny Morris. On his trip through the continental capitals, he is seen watching an unorthodox fountain in Brussels, steaming blissfully down the Rhine, admiring a rebuiilt Nuremburg, pursuing the ghost of Harry Lime in Vienna in the rain, and visiting Budapest before embarking on a journey through Yugoslavia and Bulgaria. He continues to the Golden Horn and Istanbul where he explores the town and samples the pleasures of a Turkish holiday resort and a trip down the Bosphorus.

results.title: Tick tock: all about the clock
results.creator_credit: David Boyd, Tom Wheeler and Rainbow Educational Video
results.brief_description: This video investigates why it is important to know what time it is as well as how to tell the time! It shows how various types of clocks and watches aid in the understanding of what the numbers on a clock mean, the function of the clock hands, the meaning of seconds, minutes, half hours and hours. Children will see that different kinds of clocks and watches, such as the sundial, hour glass and stopwatch, all help to keep track of the time. They will also gain an understanding of how the eart spinning on its axis causes day and night. Suitable for Kindergarten and Lower Primary level students.

results.title: Tibetan traders
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the way of life, beliefs and the epic journey of semi-nomadic traders dwelling in one of the strategic mountain passes between south-western Tibet and India in the Himalayas.

results.title: Tibetan book of the dead. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Hiroaki Mori, Yukari Hayashi, Atsunori Kawamura, David Verrall, Mistral Film, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This two-part series explores ancient teachings on death and dying. It was filmed over a four-month period on location in the Himalayas where the original text still yields an essential influence over people’s views of life and death. Narrated by Leonard Cohen, Part 2: “The Great liberation”, is a docu-drama which, in the company of a Buddhist lama and a 13-year-old novice monk, leads us into the very foundations of Buddhist philosophy - the search for compassion and truth. Pema Choden, the monk and Tubten, the young novice read from the texts of the ‘Tibetan Book of the Dead’ as they conduct the 49 days of final rites for a deceased Himalayan villager. We must all face the death of somebody we love, as well as our own death. This film helps us prepare for these inevitabilities.
